page.title: 13Education
page.content: Walkern & Ardeley each have a primary school. Walkern is a county primary school with about 66 pupils and 3 full-time and 1 part-time teachers. Most pupils go on to the Stevenage comprehensive system. The school in Ardeley is a voluntary-aided parish school, now just 150 years old, with many old pupils still in the area. It currently has 40 pupils, with about 10% coming from outside the immediate area. Most go on to the 3-tier Buntingford school system but a few go into the private sector. Extramural activities include a brownie & a cub pack & football but because of limited public transport, children rely largely on parents for activities outside the area. The schools both form a major part of the village life. Future change seem unlikely, though Ardeley remains the more vulnerable.
